Gugatan Pra Peradilan PT KDH Ditolak
07 Nov 2019, 02:41 by Tempo.co
INFO NASIONAL – Hakim Tunggal Pengadilan Negeri (PN) Tanjung Balai Karimun (TBK) kelas II, Antoni Trivolta, menggugurkan permohonan gugatan pra peradilan yang diajukan dua terdakwa pimpinan PT KDH, yaitu I dan M.Y dalam dugaan kasus tidak memungut dan membayar iuran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan terhadap 156 pekerja.
“Hakim PN Tanjung Balai Karimun menetapkan permohonan pemohon dianggap gugur. Pemohon dibebankan untuk membayar biaya perkara sejumlah lima ribu rupiah,” kata Antoni, saat membacakan penetapan gugatan pra peradilan di ruang sidang Cakra, PN TBK, Kabupaten Karimun, Kepulauan Riau, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Sidang pra peradilan Nomor 1/Pra.Pid/2019/PN.TBK yang berjalan selama 15 menit, dihadiri oleh kuasa hukum dua terdakwa sebagai Pemohon I dan II. Hadir pula Plt. Kepala UPT Binwasnaker K3 Tanjung Balai Karimun, Mujarab Mustafa dan PPNS Ketenagakerjaan Tanjung Balai Karimun, Riaiswety selaku termohon I dan II.
Kasubdit Penyidikan Tindak Pidana Norma Ketenagakerjaan dan K3, Dit.BPHK, Ditjen Binwasnaker & K3 Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan, Agus Subekti berharap penetapan hakim PN TBK kepada PT. KDH dalam persidangan pidana, bisa memberikan efek jera dalam hal pemenuhan peraturan perundang-undangan BPJS Ketenagakerjaan.
“Kami telah melakukan pembinaan secara optimal, tetapi banyak perusahaan belum mentaati aturan yang telah diberikan,” katanya.
Agus menambahkan, dengan adanya perkara ini, Kemnaker berharap menjadi pembelajaran bagi perusahaan untuk mentaati semua peraturan termasuk pembayaran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan. Kemnaker berupaya terus untuk melakukan penegakan hukum ketenagakerjaan agar iklim hubungan industrial menjadi harmonis.
“Kita berharap ke depan semua pihak terkait mematuhi dan melaksanakan semua ketentuan yang berlaku,” kata Agus.
Sehari sebelumnya, Jaksa Penuntut Umum (JPU), Herlambang Adi Nugroho membacakan surat dakwaan terhadap dua pimpinan KDH. Jaksa menilai keduanya telah melanggar aturan terkait tanggungjawab untuk menyetorkan iuran pekerja sebagai peserta BPJS Ketenagakerjaan setiap bulannya.
“Sejak bulan Desember 2018 hingga Juni 2019, terdakwa tidak membayarkan iuran 156 karyawan KDH ke BPJS Ketenagakerjaan,” ujarnya.
Jaksa Herlambang menambahkan keduanya didakwa telah melanggar pasal 19 ayat (1) dan ayat (2) Jo Pasal 55 UU RI Nomor 24 tahun 2011.
“Pemberi kerja wajib memungut iuran yang menjadi beban peserta dari pekerjanya dan menyetorkan kepada BPJS, dan Pemberi kerja wajib membayar dan menyetorkan tanggungjawabnya kepada BPJS,” ujar Herlambang saat membacakan dakwaan di persidangan.
Hadir dalam sidang pra peradilan diantaranya Kabag Penyuluhan Informasi dan Advokasi Hukum, Bambang Adi Imambrojo; Biro Hukum Kemnaker, Totok; dan Kabid Pengawasan Dinas Provinsi Kepri, Mahlan.
Sidang pidana lanjutan perkara ini akan kembali digelar pada Selasa, 12 November mendatang dengan agenda tanggapan JPU terhadap eksepsi yang diajukan tim kuasa hukum kedua terdakwa.(*)

PT KDH Pre-Trial Lawsuit Denied
Nov 7 2019, 02:41 by Tempo.co
NATIONAL INFO - Tanjung II Karimun (TBK) District Court (PN) District Court Single Judge, Antoni Trivolta, dropped the pre-trial suit filed by two defendants led by PT KDH, I and MY in the alleged case of not charging and paying BPJS Employment fees against 156 workers.
"The Tanjung Balai Karimun District Court judge determined that the petition of the petitioners was considered null and void. The petitioner is charged with paying a court fee of five thousand rupiahs, "Antoni said, while reading the determination of the pre-trial lawsuit in the Cakra courtroom, PN TBK, Karimun Regency, Riau Islands, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
The pre-trial hearing Number 1 / Pre.Pid / 2019 / PN.TBK which ran for 15 minutes, was attended by the attorneys of the two defendants as Petitioners I and II. Also attending were Plt. Head of Tanjung Balai Karimun K3 Binwasnaker K3 UPT, Mujarab Mustafa and Tanjung Balai Karimun Employment PPNS, Riaiswety as defendants I and II.
Head of Sub-Directorate of Investigation of Norms of Labor and K3 Criminal Acts, Dit.BPHK, Ditjen Binwasnaker & K3 of the Ministry of Manpower, Agus Subekti hopes that the appointment of PN TBK judges to PT. KDH in criminal proceedings, can provide a deterrent effect in terms of compliance with BPJS Manpower regulations.
"We have done coaching optimally, but many companies have not obeyed the rules that have been given," he said.
Agus added, with this case, the Ministry of Manpower hopes to be a lesson for companies to comply with all regulations including BPJS Employment payments. The Ministry of Manpower continues to enforce labor law so that the industrial relations climate becomes harmonious.
"We hope that in the future all related parties will obey and implement all applicable provisions," Agus said.
The day before, the Public Prosecutor (Prosecutor), Herlambang Adi Nugroho read out the indictment against the two KDH leaders. The prosecutor considered both of them had violated the rules regarding responsibility for depositing employee contributions as participants in the BPJS Employment every month.
"From December 2018 to June 2019, the defendant did not pay the contributions of 156 KDH employees to BPJS Employment," he said.
Prosecutor Herlambang added that both were charged with violating article 19 paragraph (1) and paragraph (2) Jo Article 55 of RI Law Number 24 of 2011.
"The employer is obliged to collect fees which are borne by the participants from his workers and deposit to BPJS, and the employer is obliged to pay and deposit his responsibilities to BPJS," Herlambang said when reading the indictment at the trial.
Present at the pre-trial hearing included the Head of Information Counseling and Legal Advocacy, Bambang Adi Imambrojo; Ministry of Manpower Law, Totok; and the Head of Supervision of the Riau Islands Provincial Office, Mahlan.
The further criminal trial will be held again on Tuesday, 12 November with the agenda of the prosecutor's response to the exception submitted by the legal team of the two defendants. (*)
